publicationstmt.publisher: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: Isaac Tryon (1741-1823) was a cabinetmaker in Glastonbury, Connecticut. He married Elizabeth Kimberly on December 25, 1771.

scopecontent.p: The account book of Isaac Tryon, 1763-1805, includes accounting of work performed by Tryon and payments for his services (payments made in cash, services, or goods). There are also Tryon family records, including births, deaths, and marriages (1771-1858), and a loose newspaper clipping from 1895 about Obed Chapman (a resident of Glastonbury).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
